If there are any more interesting details, it would be useful:

- If you had crashed in the previous session
- Was it reproducible
- Was the workspace in an inconsistent state afterwards, i.e., did you have to
shutdown and restart?

- It looks like there was some initial error, and then while the ErrorDialog was
up, another asyncExec was processed that caused a second error.  I'm wondering
if the real reason for the error is being lost.  Rafael, what was the original
ErrorDialog saying?

My guess is that it's a threading problem in the tree:

- Operation finishes in ModalContext
- resource change listeners fire asyncExecs
- meanwhile the ModalContext is manipluating the tree (for example it could be
in the middle of ElementTree.immutable())
- Now the UI thread tries to traverse the tree while in an unsafe state.

> - If you had crashed in the previous session
Sorry, I don't remember.

> - Was it reproducible
I just tried the same operation again and it didn't happen this time.

> - Was the workspace in an inconsistent state afterwards, i.e., did you have to
> shutdown and restart?
I didn't have to restart - by the way, the operation seemed to complete
properly. The error dialog appeared in the middle of the process, but the
process continued after I dismissed the dialog (I cannot remember if it was
blocked or not)

> Rafael, what was the original ErrorDialog saying?
It was one of those generic dialogs: "An internal error has occured. See log for
details".
*** Bug 49603 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 60376 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed.  I was reluctant to add synchronization here for fear of the performance
hit, but after adding synchronization to fix this and testing performance, it
doesn't seem to have an impact.  Please reopen if you find this bug in builds >
20041018.
